Field Detail

AVMId

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer AVMId
READONLY: Returns the numeric id of the AVM. The value is positive and unique per running application per schema and never reused.

isSlim

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean isSlim
READONLY: Returns true if the AVM is running in the limited slim mode

processingMode

public String processingMode
READONLY: Returns the AVM processing mode that can be one of the following: "P" - runs as PE, "U" runs as UI server, "PU" - UI server running a process engine.

Method Detail

addBenchmarkCounter

public BenchmarkCounter addBenchmarkCounter(String counterName,
                                            com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean visibleInJMX,
                                            com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean dontCreateNew,
                                            String moc,
                                            String cntDef,
                                            String cntDurationDef)
Creates a new benchmark counter. A benchmark counter is a synchronized object with unique name that accumulates performance data. The counter must be created before it is used. The counter allows recording the quantity and, optionally, the average duration of a measured item (called event). The counting can be restarted as well as stopped at any moment. If stopped the counter must be cleared in order to be used again. The benchmark counter can collect historic data about amount of events and the average duration of an event in one minute intervals for specified interval (default 24 hours). After reaching the end of the interval the counter erases the first half hour of data and continues to collect. The historic data collection can be started, stopped or restarted at any moment. On creation time the benchmark counters can be made visible in the JMX HealthCenter domain and if so they can be used in the statistics monitoring.

Parameters:
counterName - The counter name. Must be unique in the AVM. If counter with the same name already exists and the dontCreateNew flag is false it is discarded and its content is lost.
visibleInJMX - If true the counter will be visible in Benchmark type under the JMX domain.
dontCreateNew - If true and counter with the same name exists it will be returned
Returns:
The new or existing benchmark counter

createCache

public CWCache createCache(String name)
Creates the named cache. If the cache already exists returns the existing object As of 5.1. Will be deleted in 6.0. Not needed and not supported. The application caches have predefined names: theDocumentCache, theOrderCache, theResourceCache and theInterfaceDataCache

Parameters:
name - The cache name
Returns:
The cache object

getBenchmarkCounter

public BenchmarkCounter getBenchmarkCounter(String counterName)
Gets an existing benchmark counter by name. A benchmark counter is a synchronised object with AVM-wide unique name that accumulates performance data. The counter must be created before it is used.

Parameters:
counterName - The counter name. Must be unique in the application.
Returns:
The benchmark counter object or null if such counter does not exist

Gets a cache object by name

Parameters:
name - The cache name
Returns:
The cache object or null if a object with such name does not exist

getConfigVariable

public String getConfigVariable(String key)
Gets the value of a system configuration parameter as string. ConceptWave Configuration tool creates system parameters and assigns values to them.

Parameters:
key - String System parameter name
Returns:
String Parameter value or null if the parameter is not found or Fdoes not have value.

getEnvironmentType

public static String getEnvironmentType()

getSemaphore

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Object getSemaphore(String semaphoreName)
Returns the current value of a semaphore with given name. The semaphores are named, AVM-wide, synchronized objects. However if the application runs on several UI servers or process engines the semaphores do not span between the instances. Semaphores are used to synchronize operations or access to data structures. By acquiring a semaphore a script may logically "lock" the access to given resource. The semaphore can hold any type of script object that can be set and examined by the scripts.

Parameters:
semaphoreName - Semaphore name. Can't be null.
Returns:
The semaphore value or null if the semaphore does not exist.

isMultiAppDeployment

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean isMultiAppDeployment()

releaseSemaphore

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Object releaseSemaphore(String semaphoreName,
                                                         com.conceptwave.scripting.Object contains)
Deletes the semaphore. If a second parameter is given it deletes the semaphore only if its value matches the current semaphore value. If a semaphore with given name does not exist the method does nothing. The semaphores are named, AVM-wide, synchronized objects. However if the application runs on several UI servers or process engines the semaphores do not span between the instances. Semaphores are used to synchronize operations or access to data structures. By acquiring a semaphore a script may logically "lock" the access to given resource. The semaphore can hold any type of script object that can be set and examined by the scripts.

Parameters:
semaphoreName - Semaphore name. Can't be null.
contains - If not null the semaphore will be deleted only if it current value strictly matches the value of the parameter
Returns:
The semaphore value or null if the semaphore does not exist.

removeBenchmarkCounter

public BenchmarkCounter removeBenchmarkCounter(String counterName)
Removes a benchmark counter. A benchmark counter is a synchronized object with unique name that accumulates performance data.

Parameters:
counterName - The counter name.
Returns:
The removed Benchmark counter object or null the counter is not found

setSemaphore

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Object setSemaphore(String semaphoreName,
                                                     com.conceptwave.scripting.Object value,
                                                     com.conceptwave.scripting.Object newValue)
Sets a semaphore value if the semaphore exists. If the semaphore does not exist it is created. If the third parameter is not null the semaphore value will be changed only if it currently holds the value specified in the second parameter. The semaphores are named, AVM-wide, synchronised objects. However if the application runs on several UI servers or process engines the semaphores do not span between the instances. Semaphores are used to synchronise operations or access to data structures. By acquiring a semaphore a script may logically "lock" the access to given resource. The semaphore can hold any type of script object that can be set and examined by the scripts.

Parameters:
semaphoreName - String Semaphore name. Can't be null.
value - New semaphore value if the "newValue" parameter is null, otherwise - expected current semaphore value. Can't be null.
newValue - If not null, this parameter value will be set as current semaphore value only if the current value of the semaphore strictly matches a value of the "value" parameter.
Returns:
The old semaphore value, null if the semaphore value cannot be changed or the string "cw$new" if the semaphore is created.
